intro: Viola distans, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, and the plant is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Viola distans is also known for its medicinal properties, with some species used in traditional herbal remedies.
